segment.source: title: Tools for profiling and performance
segment.target: title: Tools for profiling and performance

segment.source: description: Microsoft provides several tools to help you improve the performance of your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
segment.target: description: Microsoft provides several tools to help you improve the performance of your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

segment.source: Tools for profiling and performance
segment.target: Tools for profiling and performance

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Microsoft provides several tools to help you improve the performance of your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
segment.target: Microsoft provides several tools to help you improve the performance of your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

segment.source: Follow these links to learn how to use these tools.
segment.target: Follow these links to learn how to use these tools.

segment.source: XAML UI Responsiveness tool in Visual Studio 2015.
segment.target: XAML UI Responsiveness tool in Visual Studio 2015.

segment.source: One of the best tools to use for measuring perf impact within your app is the XAML UI Responsiveness Tool.
segment.target: One of the best tools to use for measuring perf impact within your app is the XAML UI Responsiveness Tool.

segment.source: This shipped has been updated for Visual Studio 2015 to support even more scenarios.
segment.target: This shipped has been updated for Visual Studio 2015 to support even more scenarios.

segment.source: See also:
segment.target: See also:

segment.source: Analyze the performance of Windows Store apps using Visual Studio diagnostic tools
segment.target: Analyze the performance of Windows Store apps using Visual Studio diagnostic tools

segment.source: By showing you where the code of your app spends its time as your program executes, the Visual Studio profilers can help you find the performance bottlenecks in your apps, functions, and algorithms.
segment.target: By showing you where the code of your app spends its time as your program executes, the Visual Studio profilers can help you find the performance bottlenecks in your apps, functions, and algorithms.

segment.source: XAML Performance: Techniques for Maximizing Universal Windows App Experiences Built with XAML
segment.target: XAML Performance: Techniques for Maximizing Universal Windows App Experiences Built with XAML

segment.source: In this //build session, you will learn about the new platform features, new tooling features and new techniques to dramatically increase the performance of your XAML-based Universal Windows app.
segment.target: In this //build session, you will learn about the new platform features, new tooling features and new techniques to dramatically increase the performance of your XAML-based Universal Windows app.

segment.source: New XAML Tools in Visual Studio 2015
segment.target: New XAML Tools in Visual Studio 2015

segment.source: In this //build session, you will learn about some of the new capabilities in Visual Studio 2015, including the re-designed Blend experience, UI debugging tools and the XAML editor enhancements.
segment.target: In this //build session, you will learn about some of the new capabilities in Visual Studio 2015, including the re-designed Blend experience, UI debugging tools and the XAML editor enhancements.

segment.source: Windows Performance Analyzer
segment.target: Windows Performance Analyzer

segment.source: Included in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK), Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) is a tool that creates graphs and data tables of Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) events that are recorded by Windows Performance Recorder (WPR), Xperf, or an assessment that is run in the Assessment Platform.
segment.target: Included in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK), Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) is a tool that creates graphs and data tables of Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) events that are recorded by Windows Performance Recorder (WPR), Xperf, or an assessment that is run in the Assessment Platform.

segment.source: WPA can open any event trace log (ETL) file for analysis.
segment.target: WPA can open any event trace log (ETL) file for analysis.
